channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14597] Fix Groups cache in multi-threaded env
item.description: UGI doesn't hash based on the user as expected so since we have lots of ugi potentially created the cache doesn't do it's job.
item.summary: Fix Groups cache in multi-threaded env

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch that uses shortname as the cache key.
How do I know the cache is working? I don't see it in the test.
Better test for the cache with explanations.
Even more tests because why not.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12766352/HBASE-14597-v4.patch
against master branch at commit 6323cd95442bf6c2617b7e8267e0c0b76e4c47eb.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12766352

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 1754 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 1753 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestCellACLs
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.visibility.TestVisibilityLablesWithGroups
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController2
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestNamespaceCommands
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestCellACLWithMultipleVersions

-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s):

Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15988//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html

This message is automatically generated.
Test only issue. The cache is using the real hadoop Groups instance rather than the test one. I'll look at the best way to fix that.
Patch that adds in our own test groups implementation.

This message is automatically generated.
Hey a clean QA bot..... YAY

I'm not a big fan of the way TestGroups is assigned in User.createUserForTesting(), but I see that that parallels the way UGI is doing things and seems this is necessary for tests.

+1
Thanks for the review.
